haReport:
This mission was flown by:
Kmdr Patrik Schorner
Obltn Oswald Fromm
Fw Gebhard Schonbaum
Fw Ruprecht Hess

 The mission was flown from Balatre aerodrome.

Successes include the following: 
On 01/09/1916 near Roye.
A F.E.2b of Esc 21 was brought down by Patrik Schorner of Jasta 16b.
Jean-Marie Labordes was seriously wounded.
Jean-Baptiste Hocquinghen was not injured.
Patrik Schorner was  flying a Halberstadt D.II.

On 01/09/1916 near Roye.
A F.E.2b of Esc 21 was brought down by Patrik Schorner of Jasta 16b.
Edmond Canere was lightly wounded.
Ignace Breidenstein was made a prisoner of war.
Patrik Schorner was  flying a Halberstadt D.II.

On 01/09/1916 near Beuvry.
A Airco D.H.2 of No 32 Squadron RFC was brought down by Nikolaus Schildhauer of Jasta 16b.
2nd Lt Barnaby Hotham was killed in action.
Nikolaus Schildhauer was  flying a Halberstadt D.II.

On 01/09/1916 near Beuvraignes.
A F.E.2b of No 22 Squadron RFC was brought down by Fabian Spener of Jasta 16b.
2nd Lt Herman Helm was killed in action.
Cpt Everett Moland was killed in action.
Fabian Spener was  flying a Halberstadt D.II.
narrative:
A very effective mission.  We come across two groups of pushers, one French and one British, flying in parallel not at all far from each other.  I set upon one of the Frenchmen as the rest of the flight goes for an Englishman.  I fire continuously into him.  His aircraft absorbs tremendous damage before finally disintegrating and crashing.  

I turn to see my comrades attacking the English pusher.  They are causing harm but not inflicting a fatal blow.

I move on to the second Frenchman.  I fire at point blank before running out of ammunition.  I pull away but the damage is done.  His engine quits and he is forced to land behind our lines.
